conclusion: Cars A and B are traveling in the same direction on a straight road.
Their v-t graphs are shown in the figure.
It is known that the two cars are side by side at t=30s.
Car A has a constant velocity of 40 m/s from t=0 to t=30s.
Car B starts from rest and its velocity increases linearly from t=0 to t=30s.
At t=10s, Car A is ahead of Car B because Car A has been traveling at a constant velocity of 40 m/s while Car B is still accelerating from rest.
